title: Palo Alto Battlefield National Historical Park: Kids & Youth
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth             Kids & Youth         Calling all 4th graders! Get out and Find Your Park! Department of the Interior  Every Kid in a Park Marvel at the St. Louis Arch, the Florida Keys, and the Frederick Douglass house. Listen to wolves howl. Walk in dinosaur tracks. Look up into the inky night sky, and reach for the stars! These sites belong to all of us —including you. President Barack Obama created Every Kid in a Park so fourth graders and their families could discover our wildlife, resources, and history for free.        Eyewitness to War News MPC Studios  Something for the kids Palo Alto is always looking for ways to improve the park experience for families. Enjoy the current offerings below. Feel free to send us your suggestions or comments. Eyewitness To War News This "news broadcast" is a series of educational videos geared towards kids. The segments are listed in order below.  Siege of Fort Brown General Taylor General Arista Transportation Presidents Polk & Paredes U.S. Army volunteers arrive Conduct of volunteers Daguerreotypes Women in the War Medicine in the War Matamoros Marketplace Nature Food & Weather Consequences of the War     Junior Ranger Program   The Junior Ranger program is great fun for the whole family. It will enhance your visit to the park and make for fond memories as well. Learn more
